Name: Woodstag
Title: Gandhi Last Residence Museum
Review: Walking distance from our Claridges Hotel and must visit site whilst in New Delhi. It was the final residence of Mahatma Gandhi and where he was assassinated which has been turned into a museum. You see his frugal bedroom with just mattress on floor and writing desk; you can walk around and learn about his history on the wall with many pictures and artifacts. It has a well maintained garden buildings including his last steps from the house to the assassination point in the garden

Name: MikeW
Title: Memory of a Great Man
Review: Museum set up to honour Mahatma Gandhi at his final residence. His final walk to his assassination has been created on a footpath. His living quarters have been restored to as is, at the time of his death. The Museum also contains a number of information boards which document his life and major events. Entry cost is low and not many crowds. Open most days except religious holidays.

Name: smvNYC
Title: A place of reflection
Review: Our tour guide suggested to visit this place instead of the Lotus Temple and we were thankful for that. Being weekend, the area attractions were crowded. Yet Gandhi Smriti was not, and we had the opportunity to enjoy the beautifully maintained grounds, learn about Gandhi, life, work and death and understand better the history of India. Most impressive were the staff. We found them all smiling and accommodating, as they seemed to have a strong understanding of the importance and solemnity of the place!There is also a shop with books and handicrafts related to Gandhi's work. The prices were surprisingly low.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Museum Dedicated to Gandhi ji
Review: Located on Tees January Marg, it is a museum dedicated to Gandhi ji who spent the last 144 days of his life here till his assassination on 30th January, 1948. The entire complex is well maintained.

Name: JoyBose
Title: A tour of Mahatma Gandhi's life and work, memorial site of his assasination
Review: This is a museum commemorating gandhiji's life, in the building where he spent the last few months and where he was assassinated. There are a number of sections in this museum. One is the exhibition on his life, his simple living quarters, his mortal remains. It has the main events in his life, sayings by world luminiaries, his efforts at khadi and self reliance through a system of self sufficient ashrams, events in his life like naokoli satyagraha, salt march and so on. Outside the main building, there is a marked path which was the last path taken by Gandhiji before his assassination. There is a memorial at the exact place. There is also a world peace gong. There is also a small shop selling khadi products. Entry is free. This is a must visit for those interested in Indian independence movement.

Name: Where_to_travel_next
Title: Must see attraction
Review: The place was just peaceful is my best description.  You see where he lived and his footsteps he took.

Name: Meander With Mer
Title: I was truly surprised at how much I enjoyed my visit here
Review: Like the title says, I was truly surprised at how much I enjoyed and took away from my visit here.  While I have the general background on Gandhi this provided additional insight and education without being boring.  There were rooms laid out just as they were then, there were digital displays proving background and history and many dioramas showing different events in his life.  We only spent about an 1+ there but could have easily spent more.

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: GANDHI MUSEUM
Review: Gandhismriti is a museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi.It is situated on Tees january road,New delhi.It is the location where Mahatama gandhi spent the last 144 days of his life and was assassinated on 30th January 1948.

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: I reiterate...
Review: I reiterate what I wrote here  in 2014. This is a place where you find the time standing still with the memories of Mahatma Gandhi. A must visit in New Delhi.

Name: macedonboy
Title: Gandhi lived here
Review: Visited back in December and only got round to writing this review now.The museum is the former house of the Biria family and where Gandhi lived the last few months of his life. The house is now a museum dedicated to Gandhi and there’s also a column in the gardens that marks the spot where the great man was assassinated. The museum is completely free and is well worth a visit for anyone who admires Gandhi.

Name: Sanjeev Takyar
Title: Homage to Mahatma Gandhi
Review: Located on ring road near Delhi gate, the place is also known as Rajghat, one can pay tributes to Mahatma Gandhi with flowers, easily accessible from east delhi and Central Delhi.

Name: lynda763
Title: very peaceful
Review: We found this very interesting. There was no one at the entrance to pay and the guard just waved us through.It was not crowded at all so were able to walk around in peace.All the information was in English. Really worth the visit.

Name: Matt T
Title: Peaceful
Review: Really enjoyed our visit here. Very peaceful place and a bit sad. His last footsteps give you goosebumps. Lots of interesting artefacts and literature to read. A little bit of calm in a noisy bustling city.

Name: MWandAW
Title: More than his last steps
Review: My wife and I visited this lovely museum as one of the first museums on our luxury guided tour of India in March 2020. A profound way to start our adventure was to view  a memorial to the life and death of one of India's greatest humanitarians. This museum dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi, is the site where he spent the last 144 days of his life and where he was assassinated on 30 January 1948. The two storey house, which was owned by the Birla family, was converted to a memorial museum in the 1970s. The museum consists of many rooms and corridors showing photographs, oddments and documents. A covered walkway has been constructed around the enclosure and filled with photos and information about his life, politics and religion. There are gardens, sculptures and a beautifully kept lawn where the assassination took place . A dedicated walkway shows raised footprints where he walked from the house to the lawn showing his last steps on this earth. An annex shows the place he used to spend his last days and a glass showcase contains all of his worldly possessions at the end of his life. Monkeys roam around the gardens, so be careful of food and your cameras. Adequate toilet facilities are provided on the premises. Families of Indian locals, wearing their best clothes were sitting around the grounds enjoying and smiling at the endless lines of foreigners streaming past the assassination place. This memorial gets very busy which can be identified by the number of coaches in the parking area.  Despite this, a visit to this sacred memorial is highly recommended.

Name: R1chardN
Title: A moving experience
Review: We visited Ghandi Smriti as part of a City and highlights tour of Delhi.  We had to ask to have it included as it seems it is not one of the usual monuments.It is the place where Ghandi spent the end of his life and footsteps mark the route he took to his assassination.  It is incredibly moving to see the minimalist life he had and to witness his final walk and the spot where he was killed.There is an exhibition to the side of the walk way that details his life, the obstacles he overcame and the achievements of this great man.It's a must see and I would encourage you to have it added to your itinerary if it is not already.

Name: Molly1107
Title: Lovely memorial
Review: This is a lovely place to visit.  Very peaceful.Immaculately clean.Gives good insight into the life of this good man - we learned a lot.Staff very helpful.

Name: AstroBloke
Title: Very moving...
Review: This museum is a must see.  It gives some insight to a great man, and it's very moving to see where his life was sadly cut short.

Name: MamaT23
Title: The LAST walk..
Review: A wonderful stop to see where  Gandhi spent his last days along with seeing the last walk before he was assassinated.

Name: AZCasualTraveler
Title: Historical Memorial to a Great Person
Review: The Gandhi Smriti (Memorial/Musuem) is the location where Mahatma Gandhi had spent the final days of his life - before being assassinated in the garden area.  This Memorial/Museum area was formerly an estate that was once owned by a wealthy Indian business tycoon who had invited Gandhi to stay for several months.  The Museum area has pictorial displays of the life and times of Gandhi as he was growing up from childhood to adult life.  There are displays about Gandhi's history in the non-violent movement for civil rights and world freedom. At the Memorial/Museum, there is a display of the actual footsteps on the sidewalk from the Gandhi's residence to the garden area where he was  assassinated.The visit to the Gandhi Smriti was very moving to see all this history of a great person.

Name: gardenerlove
Title: Moving experience
Review: It is worth a visit, and if one is going to Mumbai Gandi's house is certainly worth a visit too. The house in Delhi is very interesting if one reads the captions it is gives one a good understanding of his life.

Name: awjones02
Title: Beautiful, educational and serene garden
Review: I had a wonderful time exploring and learning about Gandhi's life and the last days of his life. The memorial is free to enter, plenty to see and the garden is beautiful and serene.

Name: subuller
Title: Very moving
Review: We had nowhere near enough time here.  There is such a lot to read about Gandhi's history and life.  The museum itself is very tranquil and certainly gives a feeling of the Man.  Well worth taking some time to visit.

Name: Sally S
Title: A highlight of our trip
Review: We loved this free museum and celebration of the last few months of the life of Gandhi. It was really informative and a great insight into his beliefs and teachings. An interesting part of the city too. Easy to find from the metro.

Name: RicherTrips
Title: A peaceful spot
Review: This former house of an Indian entrepreneur and philanthropist hosted Mahatma in the last months of his life. This is also the place where he died, but the exhibit focus on his life, mentions his death, but not his murder, which I find very respectful.It´s better to start at the garden, where you can see many pictures with information about his life and achievements. Then, visit the house, where you´ll see his personal rooms and a collection of miniatures that explain Mahatma´s life.

Name: Gidons51
Title: The garden where Gandhi was assassinated and a museum
Review: This is the garden where Mahatma Gandhi was assassinated in 1947 . Adjacent is a modern museum exhibiting Gandhi’s life and philosophy.

Name: May O
Title: Gandhi represents India | Must Visit
Review: Private residence of Mahatma Gandhi and execution location. Sad reminder but wonderful garden, house, historical collection of pictures. Must visit in New Delhi. Located in area surrounded by old tall Neem trees, Ministries, wide road.

Name: SKC04
Title: Humble place for a leader
Review: Visited Mohatma Ghandi’s Smriti and words can not express how we felt. My wife and I were was very humble to see and walk where this great man spent his last days. Seeing his simple possessions in the simple surroundings showed us what we have all become, materialistic.🙏🏼

Name: Sam333lion
Title: Quiet place in chaotic Delhi and free museum
Review: I enjoyed my visit at the Gandhi Smriti.The place show you an overview about the history of Ghandi and also the place of his assasination.I saw many monkey in the garden.I suggest you still to read more about Gandhi life...you can find out that no man is perfect...he did help his country alot.Mostly with the salt march and his non violence movement.But read more and you will find another side of the man...but nobody perfect !Quiet place for the chaos of Delhi

Name: Rush401
Title: 2-3hours
Review: A state of the art museum where Gandhi's last moments are depicted where one feels part of the history of quit india movement.a splendid hands on museum and the tranquil garden.a must place to visit.close to metro about 30-40rs ride.

Name: Mary S
Title: Must visit place for every Indian
Review: Every Indian should include this place in their Delhi itinerary. The atmosphere is calm and peaceful and the photographs and articles helps us to understand the great man and his work . The multimedia exhibits is the first floor are innovative and nice . Totally moved seeing his last footsteps and place he was assassinated.

Name: HuntleyNewYork
Title: Visit sadly marred by our guide
Review: We were very enthusiastic to visit this special place where an icon for peace in India and revered around the world spent the last part of his life. Our expectation was a respectful contemplative experience. We also happened to be there on an important related holiday for our native country — Martin Luther King Day. Unfortunately we had a private guide who insisted on infusing criticism of Gandhi / focusing on issues such as his view that Gandhi was a hypocrite for living in such large quarters / that Gandhi was dishonest and possibly immoral in his intimate life / and other similar points of view. We felt this was totally inappropriate for the place, and could have been explored by our guide after the visit, when he continued to accompany us, as topics that might be worthy of our own research into the man if we were inclined to gather more information about his life & times. He spent barely a few minutes providing historical context or information about Gandhi’s promotion of peace while we were there, gave us no quiet time for exploration and contemplation, and was, in point of fact, the personification of the antithesis of the place itself. He is with a large very well respected company that provides luxury tours of Africa & India. We will never forgive this guide for ruining our Gandhi visit And we remain deeply saddened by it. We contacted the company and they have been very accommodating, providing us with a new guide for the balance of our trip. We are currently anxious, but hopeful, that the balance of our trip will take a more respectful tone.

Name: Sam M
Title: An enlightening experience
Review: On our stopover in New Delhi we visited Gandhi Smriti. This is where Gandhi lived and was assassinated. It was a haven of peace and tranguility just off a leafy road in New Delhi.You are taken into the room where he stayed and can see some of his personal possessions including his actual bed. There is also a room of Dioramas telling the story of his eventful life. Outside in the garden you can follow his footsteps from his room cast in red sandstone to the location where he was assassinated and also where he prayed each evening. well worth a visit.

Name: Vishwajit P
Title: Gandhiji's last steps
Review: This is where Gandhiji had taken his last steps before being shot by Nathuram Godse. The steps have been marked from this residence to prayer ground. A small temple built where he was shot. This is one of the important place to visit where 'Father of Nation' was shot. A creative art museum in line with Gandhiji's life is also worth visiting.

Name: WorldTravellerSoon
Title: A small museum and memorial place for Gandhi
Review: We visited the Gandhi Smriti on a Tuesday afternoon.  It was the (last) residence of the late Gandhi who was assassinated in the garden.  There is a small museum showing the simple lifestyle of Gandhi.  Various pictures are displayed at the garden to show a little history of Gandhi's personal life.  It is an interesting place to visit and to learn a bit about this Indian hero.

Name: Sunil
Title: Gandhi memorial hall
Review: This place has its history of mahatma Gandhi and it has a collections of Gandhi used products.Recommend place to know about Gandhi

Name: chikpick
Title: To know about Gandhiji...
Review: A great place to know indian independence struggle and role of mahatma gandhi in it. Visited by many foreign touristers. The place is really well maintained and organised. It even houses a small library with reading facility and also a shop selling khadi products. Located in a beautiful garden is the place where gandhiji was shot dead. Open to public and easily accessible.It is a place worth a visit if u r in Delhi.

Name: Vinesh R
Title: Best Sightseeing in Delhi
Review: I managed to get to a few of the recommended sightseeing spots on this trip to Delhi. This was the best place. I walked away with greater appreciation  undertaken by this great person.

Name: Amany R
Title: A must visit
Review: As a fan of Gandhi , I wanted to visit his place. It is a small building with around garden. His statue is in the middle of the garden. The place is quite and tranquil.

Name: Mohit A
Title: Lotus in pond
Review: I made a casual visit by chance which turned out to be wow experience. Pristine and serene atmosphere with must to buy from khadi store and bookstore. However the best part is museum run by birla group

Name: Paul L
Title: Fascinating Historical Site
Review: Amazing museum with fascinating exhibits. The staff were extremely helpful and interesting. I gained an even greater appreciation of Gandhi, one of the greatest human being of any age. Great look at the last days of his life.

Name: KittyKatCarey
Title: Worth the visit!
Review: Great place to get an understanding of what Gandhi stood for. Easy to follow in pictures and words. A very beautiful space that has a serenity about it even though it’s where his assassination occurred it is represented with grace. Worth a visit for sure!

Name: ghoomboom
Title: Visit to know Mahatma Gandhi personally
Review: Excellent visit. The place is in the heart of Lutyens Delhi. No congested roads. It is the place where Mahatma Gandhi spent last 144 days of his life and was assassinated by Nathu Ram Godse. The place was once Birla House but is dedicated now to Mahatma Gandhi as his memorial and museum. Some personal belongings of Gandhi with lots of informational boards about his life events and ideals is a true tryst with Mahatma. Also, there is an Audio visual museum about Mahatma which is good use of technology and is very interactive. It also shows the path from the room to the place where he was assassinated and the exact place of his death. Very interesting indeed. A must visit for every Indian and all those who want to know Mahatma more closely.

Name: Ellemay 🍹🐠🐳
Title: Impressive.
Review: The Museum contains some of Gandhi's personal belongings and is dedicated to the father of the nation. There are five pavilions one can go through the complete collection of sculpture photographs , paintings of Gandhi and the history of his philosophy.This Museum is were Gandhi was assassinated there's is also a path showing his last steps before he was assassinated. Overall - a fascinating museum displaying a wonderful collection .

Name: Damien
Title: Interesting
Review: Free inVery interesting Site of Gandhi’s last year and shooting Lovely grounds Have a lookNot much to do in Delhi A couple of days max here

Name: Kathryn_Gla
Title: Really interesting visit
Review: Ghandi Smriti was really interesting to visit.  It was very peaceful and tranquil when we visited. The exhibits are really interesting and informative about Gandhi's life. We went upstairs and a guide gave us more information about Gandhi's life and talked us through some of the exhibits. We then went outside to the garden where he was shot. Definitely worth a visit and it is well presented and maintained

Name: jazsacher
Title: enjoyable visit
Review: I enjoyed my visit to Gandhi Smriti in New Delhi.  I found it interesting to tour his home and his compound and to get up close and personal with his life.  I thought the photos with him as well were compelling as well.  But would I found most interesting was the pathway outlining his final walk before his asassination which I found poignant and personal to see.  Overall, I would recommend this visit, however I seemed to enjoy the Indira Gandhi home even more.

Name: Cristina C
Title: Not to miss!
Review: The house where Gandhi spent his last days and the place where he was killed.  It is now a museum in his honor.  Such an incredible man!  it is very moving to see how he lived, what he preached, how much he has influenced the world

Name: SrideviHari
Title: Very well-maintained, deferentially so
Review: While there are bus loads of people thronging the Indira Gandhi Museum that's a stone's throw from here, this is the place that's the true must-visit for all on our planet. I learnt a lot about how Gandhi ji spent his last days here from the well-informed lady staff/volunteer from the Art of Living organisation here to guide us around who herself held him in the highest regard. It was certainly better than just strolling around by myself as I'm won't to do at many decrepit museums in India. This place was a pleasant surprise for me. There is no entry fee and it is maintained in immaculate condition.  Ensure you block a decent part of your itinerary to visit here at leisure.

Name: Jai Hari D
Title: SMRITI IS INDEED THE BEST TRIBUTE TO THE MAHATMA
Review: Located in Lytens  New Delhi, was earlier a residence of Birla family, who graciously donated  their entire house for this memorial.The memorial is as authentic as can be . It show cases in all the rooms all  that the Mahatma used during his stay at this house. One can walk the path he took to the prayer mandap every evening .The exact location where he was assassinated comes almost alive with the last words he uttered " Hey Ram".

Name: Garon_Susanne
Title: Very moving and incredibly interesting
Review: It is worth visiting the museum and memorial out of simple respect and admiration for such and amazing wonderful human being.The grounds, Museum and site of Gandhi’s martyrdom are extremely interesting. The museum and grounds are exceptionally well maintained and provide a great insight into the life and martyrdom of Gandhi

Name: Hardtoplease75
Title: Tour group activity
Review: This was an interesting activity. We could walk at our own pace and follow Gandhi's footsteps from the room he lived in the last three plus months if his life to where he prayed for hours each day. This is now a museum and is very tranquil.

Name: Louise M
Title: Beautiful tribute
Review: Lots of information about Gandhi's life and work in the museum, with a very moving memorial in the gardens. Definitely worth a visit.

Name: RSD78
Title: Lovely, peaceful tribute
Review: This is in a quiet area of Delhi and is a fitting tribute to the great man. There's plenty of information on him and his life and it is well maintained. Can't remember the price unfortunately, but it was not expensive and well worth the money. My 12 year old had studied Gandhi in school this year and found it very interesting too.

Name: billyhockey
Title: Good place to remember a good person
Review: Mahatma Gandhi spent his last few months here, when it was called the Birla House, and was sadly assassinated here, in 1948. Gandhi's room in the house has been preserved, and his final (few) possessions are on display. The house has otherwise been converted into an interesting museum. Behind the house is a gazebo-like structure called the Martyr's Column which marks the spot where Gandhi drew his final breath after being mindlessly gunned down. We enjoyed visiting this peaceful place and taking time to remember an important and very good person. Entrance is free.

Name: Alok2108
Title: A important peice of Indian History
Review: This is a museum dedicated to the our Father of Nation Mahatma Gandhi. This is the place where he was shot dead and now is a museum with a lot of information regarding his life and his last few days of activities...One can walk along the path which Mahatma Gandhi took that fateful day and go the garden...one can easily spend a couple of hours going through the various information regarding his life and get a feel about him and get inspired...there is a very nice outlet within the premises which sells various kinds of khakhi products and its nice...a must visit so as to get a feel about this great personality...its a very peaceful place...

Name: judyUniversityPl
Title: A must visit
Review: Walk along the accompanying path that Gandhi took to Prayer January 30th. The dioramas are splendid for children and those who don’t want to read the heavy amount of photo and narrative that line the hallways. Be inspired. Find peace in this place and live mahatma Gandhi’s message.

Name: A R Kohli
Title: Place where Mahatma Gandhi was shot dead
Review: This is where our Father of Nation, Mahatma Gandhi was shot dead on Thirteeth January 1948 . Now it is a Memorial which is visited by thousands of tourists and visitors every day.Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: 222_Susie_C
Title: Poignant Museum
Review: Very moving and informative museum. Allow a couple of hours to read all the information on the walls and slowly walk around the beautiful garden.

Name: Reyan11
Title: Museum dedicated to Gandhi
Review: Birla house was converted into museum . Large number of photos , personal belongings , terracotta figures dedicated to Gandhi's life are available at this museum

Name: Ishuarav
Title: Tribute to Mahatma
Review: Gandhi smriti formerly known as Birla house where Gandhi spent his last 144days before his assassination. Gandhi's sayings and the independence struggle were nicely depicted. Gandhi's life is depicted nicely with dolls. A multimedia museum on the first floor is excellent with the guides there explaining beautifully about the significance of the depiction. Also we can pay our tribute to our father of our nation in the place where he shed his last blood. Hey Ram! Entry is free.

Name: Preet S
Title: Monuments
Review: One of the better maintained places in Delhi. Avoidable in the hot summers and also during national festivities.

Name: ginnyg0708
Title: Hidden gem of a museum
Review: I am so glad I visited Gandhi Smriti. It is an oasis of calm in a chaotic city and a fitting  tribute to the great ‘Father of the nation’, Mahatma Gandhi. You can feel his serene presence in the house and, despite the brutality of his assassination in the garden, it is peaceful.  The exhibits throughout are excellent and the Memorial beautiful in its simplicity.  I very much enjoyed my visit and learned a lot more about the man.

Name: cakewithaview
Title: In honour of Ghandi
Review: This is where Ghandi spent the last days of his life as a guest and where he was stabbed to death in the garden and there is a poignant memorial to him on the very spot. The small museum has many interactive exhibits as well as some personal items that belonged to Ghandi. I would only recommend this place if you are interested in the man himself.

Name: TheKidsMum2014
Title: Peaceful and respectful
Review: We enjoyed walking around the museum and garden. You can just walk in from the street and enjoy the gardens and memorabilia. The walk through museum by pictures/text was a bit outdated. There were repetitions of text and photos and it wouldn't take much to update this. There were a series of boxes with crafted models detailing Gandhi's life which were a bit odd, but at least in chronological order. In the garden there were more pictures and text. This is not a museum for children, unless they are late teens. Way too much reading. You get a good feel for the history by spending some time here.

Name: Tony C
Title: A place of quiet reflection and learning about Gandhi
Review: This is a tribute to Gandhi and pays respect very well. The memorial is the place where he was murdered those many years ago and includes the ability to understand his journey that day. There is also a museum which focuses on this hero of India, his life and his importance to what India now is.You probably only need about 90 minutes to take it all in.Not a must see but if you can does allow you to learn more about the man and what he did for this vast country.

Name: Aussie_Binturong
Title: A must-see
Review: This museum is free and well worth a visit. Capturing Gandhi’s life would be no easy feat but they have done a superb job of it. It features the place where he was assassinated and sandal-shaped footprints indicating his last steps before he died.

Name: Jan Nielsen
Title: Interesting place but the museum is a bit outdated
Review: It is fairly easy to go to the museum by the metro. Just hop of at the Lok Kalyan Marg station and then walk for around 15 minutes.The museum is free of charge and is placed in the buildings where Gandhi lived before being assassinated. The museum mostly consists of pictures with quotes from Gandhi and a few of his belongings. At least to us that was not overwhelming interesting.The best part of the museum is the park behind the buildings. It is very peaceful and well maintained.

Name: kamakshi2015
Title: The place of reverence !
Review: This monument is in the memory of the Father of the nation Mahatma Gandhi - the place of his assasination . The poignant memorial is a place which is hostorical least we forget .,The place is generally silent and not much crowded . No tickets . The place to pray  silently .

Name: HANS D
Title: Peaceful
Review: meditative and serene place to pay homage to the Father of the Nation. What a great simple person who did so much for our country.  lots to learn.

Name: Leandro S
Title: Interesting place
Review: Remarkable place for those who are interested in Gandhi history. Overal is a nice place and well maintained, preserving the memories and history.

Name: Ralph Wilhelm
Title: MUST MAKE TIME; most peaceful, highly significant, location-last months of Gandhi's life.
Review: Gandhi Smriti was more moving than I expected....the last almost half year of his life was lived here.  The Birla House is well kept up and maintained.  Recommend that you hire a guide if you want more background on his life and the Birla House.  Yes, many signs are in English and Hindi but the backstory is just as fascinating, plus the location of his last walk, where he was assassinated, where he lived, etc.  If you have seen the movie regarding Gandhi's life, this will all come alive with your visit.Note also plenty of older pictures of Gandhi growing up plus pictures of family and friends and key leaders of India's move to a true democracy.  Please make time; you will find it very worthwhile.

Name: marrios
Title: Tasteful memorial to a great man
Review: A small, but very informative museum / memorial. Surprisingly quiet and very peaceful. The concrete footsteps that preserve Ghandi's last steps are very poignant. Lots of clearly presented information about Ghandi's life and philosophy.

Name: BeingSakshi
Title: Nice place
Review: Must go, Life of Gandhi is depicted there.. small museum, balidan sthal. Overall a good and calm place.

Name: talkee
Title: Beautiful solemn tribute
Review: Was able to visit for the anniversary of his death. Realize I was very lucky. Many dignitaries. which is why a good guide is very important.  the grounds are beautiful and the entire area is just very calming.

Name: Spencer007
Title: Very Moving
Review: An unexpected visit, not included in our recommended schedule, or given much prominence by ‘Lonely Planet’.guide.We found it a highlight of our Delhi visit. We interesting and inspiring. An example of how a lilttel person can inspire through example fundamental change embracing wide ranging views and beliefs.Despite its horrific historical significance We  found our visit a very moving experience.

Name: travel_fan022
Title: A moving experience
Review: Visited here with a group and found the story of his life and death quite moving. The information boards are very informative and the garden is very tranquil and well kept. The footsteps marking Gandhi's last steps are very poignant. Overall this place is worth spending an hour so visiting to learn about the history of India (and Pakistan).

Name: Linda Y
Title: “Father of the Nation”
Review: Formerly known as the Birla House, this museum is dedicated to the life of Mahatma Gandhi. It was here that Gandhi spent the last 144 days of his life and was assassinated on January 30, 1948. You can view the simple room where Gandhi lived, then follow his final footsteps. The Martyr's Column marks the spot on the grounds where the "Father of the Nation" was shot during his prayers. I found my visit sobering, moving and uplifting. Here was a man that not only led India to independence but through nonviolent measures inspired other activists across the world. I visited on Jan 31, the day after India celebrates Martyrs' Day, and Gandhi’s memorial was covered in flowers.

Name: LeeLo
Title: Iconic and peaceful
Review: Set in the leafy embassy district of South Delhi, this place has a wonderful gentle feel about it. There is extensive information about his life and legacy. The grounds of the house felt so peaceful and calming on a drizzly grey day. The assassination site is iconic, and you really feel you are in a place where important history happened. Gandhi's glasses, pocket watch and other possessions are on display in his bedroom, and the overall experience feels respectful and privileged rather than tacky. The interactive exhibition upstairs can be skipped.There seems to be several Gandhi places to visit in Delhi, but we chose the right one coming here.

Name: PipPaul W
Title: The Gandhi place to visit
Review: There is a Gandhi Museum elsewhere in Delhi. That isn't a patch on this placeThis is where Gandhi spent the last 144 days of his life and where, in the gardens, he was assassinated. This area is marked by a memorial. Inside the house is the room where he lived and some artifacts,  and the rest is mostly extensive narrative and pictures. A very restful and calming place. And it is free

Name: Paul J
Title: Detailed and peaceful
Review: As we had not read much about this lovely place, we were unprepared for its gentle beauty and power.  The site of many Ghandi visits and his assassination, these buildings and grounds are understated but very interesting.  Not at all crowded when we were there, the grounds are lovely to walk on (following Ghandi’s final steps is moving), and the interiors of the main building are so very full of information about Ghandi’s life.  Take special time to see the dioramas which show scenes from Ghandi’s life, and stroll casually amid the outside walkway with interesting highlights of his early activism.  We wish we had more time here to read more.

Name: Kar C
Title: A museum for a Great man
Review: Our guide took us here and we loved it.  Since I have already seen the Raj Ghat, he suggested we go here.  We followed the footsteps of Mahatma Gandhi on his last walk to the back garden for prayers.  We saw the spot where he fell.  The building where he was staying at is the museum and details of his journey through life.  A must visit while visiting  Delhi.

Name: RichTiss
Title: Very touching to a great man
Review: Of all the sites in Delhi, this was a great visit. It was not on our itinerary but the local guide we had made a great decision to take our group of seven people there. It is one of the must visit places.

Name: pbhPlymouth
Title: Insightful
Review: This is an interesting museum into the life and final months of Ghandi's  life. This is where he was assinated.. Lovely peaceful setting and not busy.

Name: Fira.ruman
Title: Peace
Review: This is one of the finest place of peace, sacrifice and dedication. I feel pain to visit and understand how they have sacrificed there life for our country .But I would like to say who ever and how ever  if they have contributed in freedom of our country , let not politics but will respect .

Name: seeker_here
Title: For Gandhi Fans
Review: This place takes you into history as this was the place where the father of the Indian nation, Mahatma Gandhi, was shot dead.

Name: Let's Go Sightseeing
Title: evokes emotions
Review: This is the house where Mahatma Gandhi spent his last days & breathed his last. The house has been converted into a memorial now. It is incredibly peaceful inside. You will get the complete overview of the last few months of the Mahatma's life, including the partition of India & the religious riots succeeding it.The staff is dressed in khadi kurta- pajama, which adds to the aura of the place. At the exact spot where Mahatma Gandhi was shot, there is a memorial built with his last words.A multimedia display has tried to give a technological spin to the Mahatma's life & ideals in a bid to, I think, make it more relevant for school children. At the library cum store, you can read and/ or buy books related to Mahatma Gandhi.There's also a khadi store in the premises from where you can purchase khadi products. A must - visit for everyone!

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: The house where Father of Nation was shot
Review: This is the place where Gandhiji was shot by Nathuram Godse on 30th January 1948. The memorial is preserved to remind tourists of the last day of the Great Mahatma. Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: StratosLFC
Title: interesting
Review: The park is located very close to the museumIts a nice place to visit and the ticket  is cheapA fitting monument to GandhiVery central located in Delhi, and worth to visit

Name: Primestop
Title: Essential to visit
Review: Go, just go.  The site where Ghandi was assassinated - so peaceful and respectful.  Good historical information is on site and the gardens are beautifully kept.  So moving.

Name: Charl0tte2012
Title: Impressive
Review: We were impressed to see where Gandhi spent his last days. They even have his watch with the exact time he was killed. You can read his story along the wall and look at his last footsteps. Really nice memorial. There wasn't a fee to enter. A must stop.

Name: Marvin G
Title: Gandhi's Home contains a compendium of his life and work
Review: Behind a a wrought iron fence stands a beautiful while British colonial styled residential complex that was Gandhi's home in Delhi for the last 144 days of his life prior to his assassination in 1948.  Now there is a  museum in the main building that houses a number of articles associated with Gandhi's life and death.Visitors can tour the building and grounds, viewing the preserved room where Gandhi lived and the place on the grounds where he was shot while holding his nightly public walk. Gandhi was shot during his prayers at the place where Martyr's Column now stands. The museum holds a series of tableau writings with accompanying photos of Gandhi's life, development of his philosophy of "non-violence" and peaceful protest as well as an interactive exchange and video footage which display basic information on his life's work.  The home, gardens, meeting hall, peace gong and bronze statues can keep you involved for hours.  There is even a small shop purveying snacks and small lunch specials so that you can spend more time on the property taking in its importance and relevance to the world today as well as gain a greater appreciation of Gandhi.  There is even a shop that offers crafts and clothing on the premises that's government-certified and price-fixed.  We spent over three hours on the premises and could have used a full day to take in all of the artifacts and history on display here.  The Smriti (Remembrance) is a must when visiting Delhi.

Name: igolfCA
Title: Well done memorial
Review: This is the place where Gandhi spent his remaining days in Delhi and marks the spot where he was assassinated. It was a very moving experience and well done. Visit the museum for information about his life and what he stood for to make this a better world.The path he took to the spot where he was assassinated is marked with footsteps so you can see exactly where he went. His simple bedroom is also open to visit and gives you a glimpse of how he lived. Lots of information to read. Well done.

Name: Allen H
Title: Dignified memorial and interesting museum.
Review: A beautiful house and a lovely garden. The presentation of Gandhi’s story and specific information about his last few days in Delhi are extremely well presented. Lots of information in a variety of formats - visit the upstairs multimedia presentations.Calm , peaceful and thought provoking.Certainly worth an hour during any visit to Delhi.

Name: Michael D
Title: Gandhi Smriti
Review: This is the place Ghandi spent his last days before being assassinated. His simple room that he lived while here.  Also the exact spot where he was assassinated on his way to prayer. This is an emotional experience and you are hit with sadness and sacredness when you first enter the property.   There is no charge and a lot of written description as well as video footage.  You can spend hours there.   Upstairs there is an interactive museum that is very good for all ages.  If in Dehli, you must see this to better appreciate Gandhi's life.

Name: Cay
Title: Special Place
Review: Feeling blessed to be able to visit this place. Very informative and very good place to immerse yourself with Gandhi teachings and his bravery

Name: Susan M
Title: Gandhi's life story
Review: This site is so much more than Gandhi's assassination site.  The museum on the grounds gives a thorough overview of his story, from education in England to South Africa before his return to India.  Kudos to the caretakers of the grounds; they ensure that his memory is respected by all visitors.  This site needs a few hours because there is so much to see.

Name: Geeess
Title: Amazing grace
Review: This is the old Birla house where Mahatma Gandhi the apostle of non violence lived the last 3 months of his great life. This is also the place he was assassinated. It is a well organised place ,No entry fee but a registration is sought.The simple room that Gandhiji lived in is well spending some time in to understand his simplicity. The path to the spot of his assassination is marked with his footsteps To go  to the actual point shoes need to be removed.There are hand spun and cottage industry shops on the premises I found it  a place of great reverence and historically important

Name: Ana P.
Title: Fantastic.  Must go.
Review: Fantastic, I add a note of well preserved. You do not leave sad but hopeful. A must go, if you missed it, you would have no sense of this icon importance for his countrymen.

Name: Yogadeva
Title: A good place for quiet reflection
Review: There is a lot of information to take in here, with details of all of Gandhi’s life as well as how his last days unfolded. It has been slightly upgraded since I was last there, with a new block of toilets and a better sense of direction through the outdoor part of the display. Birla house remains as beautiful as ever and that alone gives one a sense of the elegant charm of that era, contrasted all the more starkly with the violent assassination of a frail old man. Not to be missed if you’re interested in Indian society and history.

Name: Christine F
Title: A very interesting visit to Ghandi's final footsteps!
Review: This building is an insight into the final hours of Ghandi's life. A very humbling experience, well preserved with dignity and respect. Not a huge site to visit but worth going to experience the reality of this man and his passion for peace.
